title: Compiling SciPy's scipy/optimize/slsqp

labels.name: SciPy
labels.description: issues related to enable LFortran to compile the entire FORTRAN codebase in SciPy

body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/580

We should start with one subdirectory, fully compile, and then go from there. In this issue we'll do `scipy/optimize/slsqp`. Issues:

#### Label before `END`

Fix:
```diff
--- a/scipy/optimize/slsqp/slsqp_optmz.f
+++ b/scipy/optimize/slsqp/slsqp_optmz.f
@@ -585,7 +585,8 @@ C   END OF MAIN ITERATION
 
 C   END OF SLSQPB
 
-  330 END
+  330 CONTINUE
+      END
 
```
There are several of these.

#### `GO TO next,(30, 50, 70, 110)`

Fix:
```diff
--- a/scipy/optimize/slsqp/slsqp_optmz.f
+++ b/scipy/optimize/slsqp/slsqp_optmz.f
@@ -2003,7 +2003,16 @@ C     DATA CUTLO, CUTHI / 4.441E-16,  1.304E19 /
       nn = n * incx
 C                       BEGIN MAIN LOOP
       i = 1
-   20    GO TO next,(30, 50, 70, 110)
+   20 CONTINUE
+      IF (next == 30) then
+          GO TO 30
+      ELSEIF (next == 50) then
+          GO TO 50
+      ELSEIF (next == 70) then
+          GO TO 70
+      ELSEIF (next == 110) then
+          GO TO 110
+      ENDIF
    30 IF( ABS(dx(i)) .GT. cutlo) GO TO 85
       assign 50 to next
       xmax = ZERO
```

With the above two workarounds, it can now be parsed:
```console
$ lfortran --fixed-form --show-ast slsqp_optmz.f
[AST printout]
```

Then it seems the `--fixed-form` is not honored for `--show-asr`:
```console
$ lfortran --fixed-form --show-asr slsqp_optmz.f
input:2:8 syntax error: token type 'identifier' is unexpected here
C      ALGORITHM 733, COLLECTED ALGORITHMS FROM ACM.
       ^~~~~~~~~
Parsing error: syntax error
```
Workaround:
```console
$ lfortran fmt --fixed-form --no-color slsqp_optmz.f > a.f90
$ lfortran --show-ast a.f90
[AST printout]
```
Now ASR fails with:
```
$ lfortran --show-asr a.f90
Semantic error: Only one attribute can be specified if type is missing
```
